e_subtitle: Select the highlighted team members to listen to the team’s conversation.

introModal.e_text:
This activity is organized into the Build Business Case, Develop, Scale Up, and Launch phases of commercialization.

As each phase begins, you will listen to conversations between your team members which will set the stage for events or challenges that have arisen as the team develops a new product: a specialized painter’s tape to be sold in stores to customers.

Once the team’s conversation wraps up, you will view an activity map along with your performance indicators. You can select activities to complete in any order you wish, answering questions within them to raise your performance. Along the way, you have opportunities to earn badges representing knowledge areas for Quality.

Ready to get started? Let’s go!

conclusionModal.e_text:
Congratulations! You navigated the new product commercialization of the painting tape from start to finish: From BBC to post-Launch. You applied your knowledge of Quality tools, systems, and responsibilities to work with your team.

Next, let’s review your results.

low.e_title: It looks like you could have performed better.
low.e_text:
It looks like you struggled to achieve high success in this scenario. You may have opportunities to expand on your knowledge of how the Quality focus contributes to new product commercialization.

To make sure you have the basics you will want to visit some of the questions you’ve missed. You may also want to re-explore previous lessons in the course to aid you in making the best choices.

med.e_text:
You demonstrated knowledge of how the Quality focus contributes to new product commercialization, but there is an opportunity to reach better results in this scenario.

To make sure you’ve mastered the Quality focus, you may want to visit some of the questions you’ve missed.

When you are ready, you may proceed to the conclusion.

high.e_text:
You’ve demonstrated thorough knowledge of how the Quality focus contributes to new product commercialization.

If you wish, you can revisit questions if you missed them. Otherwise, you may proceed to the conclusion.

perfect.e_text:
You’ve demonstrated thorough knowledge of how the Quality focus contributes to new product commercialization.

If you wish, you can revisit questions if you missed them. Otherwise, you may proceed to the conclusion.

badges.text: Congratulations! Your efforts in translating customer needs into design specifications has earned you the Customer Advocate Badge!
badges.caption: Customer Advocate

badges.text: Congratulations! You have inspected a potential failure mode in the product/process by examining testing performance, uncovering a necessary redesign. You’ve earned the Test Evaluator Badge!
badges.caption: Test Evaluator Badge

badges.text: Excellent work! You’ve taken all the steps necessary after the painting tape underwent a necessary redesign, all while ensuring that the VOC remained amplified in the process. Your diligence has earned you the Robust Designer Badge!
badges.caption: Robust Designer Badge

badges.text: Fantastic! You worked with a primary supplier for the materials for the painting tape to ensure that issues with their quality system were addressed. This has earned you the Systems Master Badge!
badges.caption: Systems Master Badge

badges.text: Congratulations! You collaborated with the team to ensure that the VOC was correctly retranslated, and you’ve worked to document the process so that the painting tape can continue to be successful into its market life cycle. Your thorough efforts have earned you the Documentation Champion Badge!
badges.caption: Documentation Champion Badge

e_listenAgainText: You can listen again by selecting any of the outlined team members.

conclusion.title: Build Business Case Completed!
conclusion.html: By presenting a strong business case at the gate review, the executive team recommends that the product move forward with a “Go” decision.

areas.e_transcript:
Team, we’ve collected and compared the information we gathered in Discover. Let’s get to work on Building the Business Case for this new painter’s tape we hope to take to Launch.

I’ll contribute to our feasibility assessment from the business perspective.

Quality, we’ll need your help in reviewing Lab's initial translation of the voice of the customer from functional prototypes and test data. We will then look to you to help draft the Quality Plan and advise us on ways to reduce risk in our product and process design. Be on the lookout for any opportunities you see to guide us.
I will begin working on the product requirements and design to identify the best solution for the customer. My team will begin building pilot scale prototypes and defining test methods.

Since we know the type of product and the primary market, I will provide product safety and environmental expertise, services, and governance for the project, beginning with the Environmental Health, Safety, and Rehabilitation assessment.

It will be helpful to know which countries you will manufacture and sell the tape in. Thanks for collaborating with me early so that we can best anticipate regulatory requirements.
I will work with the product developer to identify the intellectual property plan for the new product and confirm Freedom to Operate clearance.

I will start the preliminary needs assessment for the data package, including value stream maps, capital needs, supplier assessment and selection, and manufacturing compliance requirements.

Once the team understands the market and has a validated prototype, I will work with Quality on risk assessments for manufacturing, supply chain, sourcing, and the value stream.

conclusion.title: Development Completed!
conclusion.html: The painting tape underwent two redesigns to ensure that it will be of the highest quality, and raw material samples have been selected. The tape has passed the gate review and your efforts in Scape Up can begin!

areas.e_transcript:
Now that we are in Development, we need to confirm we have a robust product design that is optimized for our customer.

Quality, I'll need your help to make sure we are using the right statistical tools as we evaluate our product capability and test methods.

I'm assembling the data package for manufacturing. Quality, I'll need your help in including the analysis of the MSAs, DOEs, and quality plans in the data package. Our team should also review and update the FMEAs.

I see that there have been some changes to the product construction and manufacturing plan since Build Business Case.

I'll update my LCM/EHS&R information for this project so we can be confident there are no product stewardship concerns.

conclusion.title: Scale Up Completed!
conclusion.html: Your team completed the necessary tasks in Scale Up for the product and proceeded to the gate review. The results of the review were positive, and the executive team approved the product for Launch with a “Go” decision.

areas.e_transcript:
I’d like to congratulate the team on entering Scale Up.

I’ve completed IP and Freedom to Operate checks on the painting tape and it appears that we have no challenges.
There are some process capability questions that have arisen. Quality, we could use your guidance.
We may have uncovered some concerns with one of our chief suppliers that I’d like to review with Quality.

conclusion.title: You completed the Product Journey!
conclusion.html:
The product was taken from an idea in Discover to a successful part of 3M’s business strategy post Launch.

But how effective was your team throughout this journey?

Let’s review your results.

areas.e_transcript:
Team, while the Launch of the tape has largely been successful, we have some improvement opportunities based on our KPIs.

Customer feedback indicates that we may have some variation in the adhesion performance of the tape. and surprisingly, the tape has had complaints about color. This needs investigation.

Finally, were aware of a product failure in one of our submarkets. It appears that adhesive glue is oozing onto the inside of the packaging.

Quality, we’ll look to you to investigate these issues and help guide what interventions we should take.

If part of the problem is product specification variation falling outside of our defined limits, we will need to check our Manufacturing Control Plan.

Quality, I could use your help to identify where we may have an issue.
